intro: Trillium ovatum f. maculosum, commonly known as the spotted white trillium, is a rare and distinctive variant of the white trillium. It is characterized by its pale green to white petals with scattered red or brown spots, giving it a unique appearance. This plant is native to the Pacific Northwest of North America and thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and produces a single, showy flower with three petals and three sepals. The foliage consists of three broad, waxy leaves that emerge from a short stem.
